pageContext.claim: “The meatpacking plants now are doing very well. There's great testing around those plants. And we're finding out who had the problem. They're being quarantined. And the meatpacking is moving along very nicely.”
pageContext.analysis: In fact, meatpacking plants have been frequent sites of covid-19 outbreaks across the country, with at least 10,000 recorded cases linked to them the week before Trump made these comments. The CDC investigated when states began to ask about the issue and found that many meatpacking industry workers live in communal settings and that the facilities and the physical conditions of the work did not lend themselves easily to social distancing and other safety measures.
